net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.content.querybuilder

Class SelectionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.content.querybuilder.QueryBuilder<SelectionBuilder,android.database.Cursor>
      • net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.content.querybuilder.SelectionBuilder

  • public class SelectionBuilder
extends QueryBuilder<SelectionBuilder,android.database.Cursor>
    Builds an insertion query against a given ContentResolver and Uri.

    Examples

         Cursor crs = QueryBuilder.selectFrom( rslv, uri )
             .allColumns()
             .where( "entity_id=?", sID )
             .execute()
             ;
 
         Cursor crs = QueryBuilder.selectFrom( rslv, uri )
             .columns( "entity_id", "name", "start_ts", "stop_ts" )
             .where( "start_ts>?", TimeUtils.now() )
             .orderBy( "name", ContentUtils.QUERY_ORDER_ASCENDING )
             .execute()
             ;
    Since:
    zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#39)
    See Also:
    ContentUtils.QUERY_ORDER_ASCENDING, ContentUtils.QUERY_ORDER_DESCENDING

      • m_mapSortSpec

        protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> m_mapSortSpec
        The mapping of sortable columns to sorting directions, if any. This is a LinkedHashMap because we want to preserve the order in which sort keys were added to the order spec. (#52)

      • getColumns

        protected java.lang.String[] getColumns()
        Generates the list of columns to be included in the result set, as an array of strings to be passed to ContentResolver.query(android.net.Uri, java.lang.String[], java.lang.String, java.lang.String[], java.lang.String).
        Returns:
        a list of column names, or null if all columns are to be included

        public SelectionBuilder orderBy(java.lang.String sColumn)

        Parameters:
        sColumn - the column to be added to the sort specification
        Returns:
        (fluid)

        Returns:

      • executeOrCancel

        public android.database.Cursor executeOrCancel(android.os.CancellationSignal sig)
                                        throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException,
                                               QueryBuilder.ExecutionException
        (API 16+) Selects results from the data context, while allowing the query to be cancelled in response to the specified signal.
        Parameters:
        sig - the signal which would cancel the query
        Returns:
        a set of results from the data context
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException
        QueryBuilder.ExecutionException

      • executeOrCancel

        public android.database.Cursor executeOrCancel(android.content.ContentResolver rslv,
                                               android.net.Uri uri,
                                               android.os.CancellationSignal sig)
                                        throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException,
                                               QueryBuilder.ExecutionException
        (API 16+) Selects results from the data context, while allowing the query to be cancelled in response to the specified signal. Usually, this is not invoked directly, but is instead consumed by executeOrCancel(CancellationSignal).
        Parameters:
        rslv - the resolver through which the query should be executed
        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        sig - the signal which would cancel the query
        Returns:
        a set of results from the data context
        Throws:
        UnboundException - if the data context binding is inadequate
        ExecutionException - if the underlying query fails
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException
        QueryBuilder.ExecutionException

      • toBundle

        public android.os.Bundle toBundle()
        Creates a bundle that describes the query itself, not the result set that it would select. Used to pass the query specification across an intent broadcast, in a provider/resolver model. The schema for this bundle is consistent and is defined as follows:
        String uri
        The URI at which the query is aimed.
        String[] columns
        The list of selection columns. Null implies all columns.
        String where_format
        The format string for the query's WHERE clause.
        String[] where_params
        The list of parameters to be substituted in the query's WHERE clause format string.
        String[] order_by_cols (optional)
        The list of columns on which the query is to be sorted.
        String[] order_by_dirs (optional)
        The list of sort directions (ascending/descending) for each column mentioned in order_by_cols.
        Returns:
        a bundle describing the selection query itself
        Since:
        zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#50)
